item.title: Extractive Question Answering application.
item.author: raphael.sourty@gmail.com (Raphael Sourty)
item.description: This blog post is a response to Max Halford’s blog post “NLP at Carbonfact: how would you do it? In his blog post, Max proposes a procedure to automate a part of clothes’ life cycle analysis (LCA). The LCA aims, among other things, to estimate the amount of carbon needed to produce a good. The specific task he is working to solve is to identify named entities and create structured data from those entities.

item.title: Bio
item.author: raphael.sourty@gmail.com (Raphael Sourty)
item.description: Hi there 👋, I’m a third-year Ph.D. student at Paul Sabatier University, doing my research for Renault’s Applied Artificial Intelligence team. I work on NLP and Knowledge Graph. In addition, I study Mutual Learning and Knowledge Distillation. Some of the applications of my PhD are: Information Retrieval 📑 Classification 🔍 Recommendation ⭐️ Knowledge-intensive tasks 📚 I’m a Python developer interested in: Software Engineering 🐍 Machine Learning 🤖 Statistics 📈 Data Viz 📊 Databases 💾 Cloud 🐳 I contribute to some open-source libraries and often participate in machine learning competitions.
